bioghist.p: Aaron Michael Myers (1897-1937?) was on the faculty of Temple University. He received his doctorate from the University of Pennsylvania in 1931. He and his wife were avid theater-goers.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of clippings, brochures, programs, postcards, and photographs related to England and Shakespearean theater, assembled by Aaron Michael Myers. The bulk of the collection consists of scrapbook pages from Myers' trip to England in the 1930s, arranged by location, with postcards, travel brochures, photographs, and programs. Included are playbills from performances at the Shakespeare Memorial Theater in Stratford Upon Avon, with manuscript annotations by Myers, and issues of the Shakespeare Pictorial (1940-1942). The collection also includes playbills and clippings of reviews of performances of Shakespeare plays at several Philadelphia theaters, including the Broad Street Theater, the Abbey Theater, the Garrick Theater, and the Forrest Theater.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
